00050 #ifndef __CVMX_ATOMIC_H__
00051 #define __CVMX_ATOMIC_H__
00052 
00053 #include "cvmx-asm.h"
00054 
00055 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00056 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00057 extern "C" {
00058 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 /**
00062  * Atomically adds a signed value to a 32 bit (aligned) memory location.
00063  *
00064  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00065  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00066  * ordering constraints.  (This should NOT be used for reference counting -
00067  * use the standard version instead.)
00068  *
00069  * @param ptr    address in memory to add incr to
00070  * @param incr   amount to increment memory location by (signed)
00071  */
00072 static inline void cvmx_atomic_add32_nosync(int32_t * ptr, int32_t incr)
00073 {
00074 
00075 #ifdef CVMX_CAVIUM_OCTEON2
00076     {
00077         __asm__ __volatile__("   saa %[inc], (%[base]) \n":"+m"(*ptr)
00078                      :[inc] "r"(incr),[base] "r"(ptr)
00079                      :"memory");
00080     }
00081 #else
00082     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN3XXX)) {
00083         uint32_t tmp;
00084 
00085         __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00086                      ".set noreorder         \n"
00087                      "1: ll   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00088                      "   addu %[tmp], %[inc] \n"
00089                      "   sc   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00090                      "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n" "   nop                 \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp)
00091                      :[inc] "r"(incr)
00092                      :"memory");
00093     } else {
00094         __asm__ __volatile__("   saa %[inc], (%[base]) \n":"+m"(*ptr)
00095                      :[inc] "r"(incr),[base] "r"(ptr)
00096                      :"memory");
00097     }
00098 #endif
00099 }
00100 
00101 /**
00102  * Atomically adds a signed value to a 32 bit (aligned) memory location.
00103  *
00104  * Memory access ordering is enforced before/after the atomic operation,
00105  * so no additional 'sync' instructions are required.
00106  *
00107  *
00108  * @param ptr    address in memory to add incr to
00109  * @param incr   amount to increment memory location by (signed)
00110  */
00111 static inline void cvmx_atomic_add32(int32_t * ptr, int32_t incr)
00112 {
00113     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00114     cvmx_atomic_add32_nosync(ptr, incr);
00115     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00116 }
00117 
00118 /**
00119  * Atomically sets a 32 bit (aligned) memory location to a value
00120  *
00121  * @param ptr    address of memory to set
00122  * @param value  value to set memory location to.
00123  */
00124 static inline void cvmx_atomic_set32(int32_t * ptr, int32_t value)
00125 {
00126     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00127     *ptr = value;
00128     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00129 }
00130 
00131 /**
00132  * Returns the current value of a 32 bit (aligned) memory
00133  * location.
00134  *
00135  * @param ptr    Address of memory to get
00136  * @return Value of the memory
00137  */
00138 static inline int32_t cvmx_atomic_get32(int32_t * ptr)
00139 {
00140     return *(volatile int32_t *)ptr;
00141 }
00142 
00143 /**
00144  * Atomically adds a signed value to a 64 bit (aligned) memory location.
00145  *
00146  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00147  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00148  * ordering constraints.  (This should NOT be used for reference counting -
00149  * use the standard version instead.)
00150  *
00151  * @param ptr    address in memory to add incr to
00152  * @param incr   amount to increment memory location by (signed)
00153  */
00154 static inline void cvmx_atomic_add64_nosync(int64_t * ptr, int64_t incr)
00155 {
00156 #ifdef CVMX_CAVIUM_OCTEON2
00157     {
00158         __asm__ __volatile__("   saad %[inc], (%[base])  \n":"+m"(*ptr)
00159                      :[inc] "r"(incr),[base] "r"(ptr)
00160                      :"memory");
00161     }
00162 #else
00163     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN3XXX)) {
00164         uint64_t tmp;
00165         __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00166                      ".set noreorder         \n"
00167                      "1: lld  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00168                      "   daddu %[tmp], %[inc] \n"
00169                      "   scd  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00170                      "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n" "   nop                 \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp)
00171                      :[inc] "r"(incr)
00172                      :"memory");
00173     } else {
00174         __asm__ __volatile__("   saad %[inc], (%[base])  \n":"+m"(*ptr)
00175                      :[inc] "r"(incr),[base] "r"(ptr)
00176                      :"memory");
00177     }
00178 #endif
00179 }
00180 
00181 /**
00182  * Atomically adds a signed value to a 64 bit (aligned) memory location.
00183  *
00184  * Memory access ordering is enforced before/after the atomic operation,
00185  * so no additional 'sync' instructions are required.
00186  *
00187  *
00188  * @param ptr    address in memory to add incr to
00189  * @param incr   amount to increment memory location by (signed)
00190  */
00191 static inline void cvmx_atomic_add64(int64_t * ptr, int64_t incr)
00192 {
00193     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00194     cvmx_atomic_add64_nosync(ptr, incr);
00195     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00196 }

00198 /**
00199  * Atomically sets a 64 bit (aligned) memory location to a value
00200  *
00201  * @param ptr    address of memory to set
00202  * @param value  value to set memory location to.
00203  */
00204 static inline void cvmx_atomic_set64(int64_t * ptr, int64_t value)
00205 {
00206     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00207     *ptr = value;
00208     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00209 }

00211 /**
00212  * Returns the current value of a 64 bit (aligned) memory
00213  * location.
00214  *
00215  * @param ptr    Address of memory to get
00216  * @return Value of the memory
00217  */
00218 static inline int64_t cvmx_atomic_get64(int64_t * ptr)
00219 {
00220     return *(volatile int64_t *)ptr;
00221 }
00222 
00223 /**
00224  * Atomically compares the old value with the value at ptr, and if they match,
00225  * stores new_val to ptr.
00226  * If *ptr and old don't match, function returns failure immediately.
00227  * If *ptr and old match, function spins until *ptr updated to new atomically, or
00228  *  until *ptr and old no longer match
00229  *
00230  * Does no memory synchronization.
00231  *
00232  * @return 1 on success (match and store)
00233  *         0 on no match
00234  */
00235 static inline uint32_t cvmx_atomic_compare_and_store32_nosync(uint32_t * ptr, uint32_t old_val, uint32_t new_val)
00236 {
00237     uint32_t tmp, ret;
00238 
00239     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00240                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00241                  "1: ll   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00242                  "   li   %[ret], 0     \n"
00243                  "   bne  %[tmp], %[old], 2f \n"
00244                  "   move %[tmp], %[new_val] \n"
00245                  "   sc   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00246                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n"
00247                  "   li   %[ret], 1      \n" "2: nop               \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret)
00248                  :[old] "r"(old_val),[new_val] "r"(new_val)
00249                  :"memory");
00250 
00251     return (ret);
00252 
00253 }
00254 
00255 /**
00256  * Atomically compares the old value with the value at ptr, and if they match,
00257  * stores new_val to ptr.
00258  * If *ptr and old don't match, function returns failure immediately.
00259  * If *ptr and old match, function spins until *ptr updated to new atomically, or
00260  *  until *ptr and old no longer match
00261  *
00262  * Does memory synchronization that is required to use this as a locking primitive.
00263  *
00264  * @return 1 on success (match and store)
00265  *         0 on no match
00266  */
00267 static inline uint32_t cvmx_atomic_compare_and_store32(uint32_t * ptr, uint32_t old_val, uint32_t new_val)
00268 {
00269     uint32_t ret;
00270     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00271     ret = cvmx_atomic_compare_and_store32_nosync(ptr, old_val, new_val);
00272     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00273     return ret;
00274 
00275 }
00276 
00277 /**
00278  * Atomically compares the old value with the value at ptr, and if they match,
00279  * stores new_val to ptr.
00280  * If *ptr and old don't match, function returns failure immediately.
00281  * If *ptr and old match, function spins until *ptr updated to new atomically, or
00282  *  until *ptr and old no longer match
00283  *
00284  * Does no memory synchronization.
00285  *
00286  * @return 1 on success (match and store)
00287  *         0 on no match
00288  */
00289 static inline uint64_t cvmx_atomic_compare_and_store64_nosync(uint64_t * ptr, uint64_t old_val, uint64_t new_val)
00290 {
00291     uint64_t tmp, ret;
00292 
00293     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00294                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00295                  "1: lld  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00296                  "   li   %[ret], 0     \n"
00297                  "   bne  %[tmp], %[old], 2f \n"
00298                  "   move %[tmp], %[new_val] \n"
00299                  "   scd  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00300                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n"
00301                  "   li   %[ret], 1      \n" "2: nop               \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret)
00302                  :[old] "r"(old_val),[new_val] "r"(new_val)
00303                  :"memory");
00304 
00305     return (ret);
00306 
00307 }
00308 
00309 /**
00310  * Atomically compares the old value with the value at ptr, and if they match,
00311  * stores new_val to ptr.
00312  * If *ptr and old don't match, function returns failure immediately.
00313  * If *ptr and old match, function spins until *ptr updated to new atomically, or
00314  *  until *ptr and old no longer match
00315  *
00316  * Does memory synchronization that is required to use this as a locking primitive.
00317  *
00318  * @return 1 on success (match and store)
00319  *         0 on no match
00320  */
00321 static inline uint64_t cvmx_atomic_compare_and_store64(uint64_t * ptr, uint64_t old_val, uint64_t new_val)
00322 {
00323     uint64_t ret;
00324     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00325     ret = cvmx_atomic_compare_and_store64_nosync(ptr, old_val, new_val);
00326     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00327     return ret;
00328 }
00329 
00330 /**
00331  * Atomically adds a signed value to a 64 bit (aligned) memory location,
00332  * and returns previous value.
00333  *
00334  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00335  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00336  * ordering constraints.  (This should NOT be used for reference counting -
00337  * use the standard version instead.)
00338  *
00339  * @param ptr    address in memory to add incr to
00340  * @param incr   amount to increment memory location by (signed)
00341  *
00342  * @return Value of memory location before increment
00343  */
00344 static inline int64_t cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_add64_nosync(int64_t * ptr, int64_t incr)
00345 {
00346     uint64_t ret;
00347 
00348 #ifdef CVMX_CAVIUM_OCTEON2
00349     {
00350         if (__builtin_constant_p(incr) && incr == 1) {
00351             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00352                          "laid  %0,(%2)"
00353                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret), "+m"(ptr):"r"(ptr):"memory");
00354         } else if (__builtin_constant_p(incr) && incr == -1) {
00355             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00356                          "ladd  %0,(%2)"
00357                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret), "+m"(ptr):"r"(ptr):"memory");
00358         } else {
00359             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00360                          "laad  %0,(%2),%3"
00361                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret), "+m"(ptr):"r"(ptr), "r"(incr):"memory");
00362         }
00363     }
00364 #else
00365     {
00366         uint64_t tmp;
00367         __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00368                      ".set noreorder         \n"
00369                      "1: lld   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00370                      "   move  %[ret], %[tmp] \n"
00371                      "   daddu %[tmp], %[inc] \n"
00372                      "   scd   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00373                      "   beqz  %[tmp], 1b     \n" "   nop                  \n" ".set pop            \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret)
00374                      :[inc] "r"(incr)
00375                      :"memory");
00376     }
00377 #endif
00378 
00379     return (ret);
00380 }
00381 
00382 /**
00383  * Atomically adds a signed value to a 64 bit (aligned) memory location,
00384  * and returns previous value.
00385  *
00386  * Memory access ordering is enforced before/after the atomic operation,
00387  * so no additional 'sync' instructions are required.
00388  *
00389  * @param ptr    address in memory to add incr to
00390  * @param incr   amount to increment memory location by (signed)
00391  *
00392  * @return Value of memory location before increment
00393  */
00394 static inline int64_t cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_add64(int64_t * ptr, int64_t incr)
00395 {
00396     uint64_t ret;
00397     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00398     ret = cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_add64_nosync(ptr, incr);
00399     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00400     return ret;
00401 }
00402 
00403 /**
00404  * Atomically adds a signed value to a 32 bit (aligned) memory location,
00405  * and returns previous value.
00406  *
00407  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00408  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00409  * ordering constraints.  (This should NOT be used for reference counting -
00410  * use the standard version instead.)
00411  *
00412  * @param ptr    address in memory to add incr to
00413  * @param incr   amount to increment memory location by (signed)
00414  *
00415  * @return Value of memory location before increment
00416  */
00417 static inline int32_t cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_add32_nosync(int32_t * ptr, int32_t incr)
00418 {
00419     uint32_t ret;
00420 
00421 #ifdef CVMX_CAVIUM_OCTEON2
00422     {
00423         if (__builtin_constant_p(incr) && incr == 1) {
00424             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00425                          "lai  %0,(%2)"
00426                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret), "+m"(ptr):"r"(ptr):"memory");
00427         } else if (__builtin_constant_p(incr) && incr == -1) {
00428             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00429                          "lad  %0,(%2)"
00430                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret), "+m"(ptr):"r"(ptr):"memory");
00431         } else {
00432             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00433                          "laa  %0,(%2),%3"
00434                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret), "+m"(ptr):"r"(ptr), "r"(incr):"memory");
00435         }
00436     }
00437 #else
00438     {
00439         uint32_t tmp;
00440 
00441         __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00442                      ".set noreorder         \n"
00443                      "1: ll   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00444                      "   move %[ret], %[tmp] \n"
00445                      "   addu %[tmp], %[inc] \n"
00446                      "   sc   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00447                      "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n" "   nop                 \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret)
00448                      :[inc] "r"(incr)
00449                      :"memory");
00450     }
00451 #endif
00452 
00453     return (ret);
00454 }
00455 
00456 /**
00457  * Atomically adds a signed value to a 32 bit (aligned) memory location,
00458  * and returns previous value.
00459  *
00460  * Memory access ordering is enforced before/after the atomic operation,
00461  * so no additional 'sync' instructions are required.
00462  *
00463  * @param ptr    address in memory to add incr to
00464  * @param incr   amount to increment memory location by (signed)
00465  *
00466  * @return Value of memory location before increment
00467  */
00468 static inline int32_t cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_add32(int32_t * ptr, int32_t incr)
00469 {
00470     uint32_t ret;
00471     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00472     ret = cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_add32_nosync(ptr, incr);
00473     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00474     return ret;
00475 }

00477 /**
00478  * Atomically set bits in a 64 bit (aligned) memory location,
00479  * and returns previous value.
00480  *
00481  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00482  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00483  * ordering constraints.
00484  *
00485  * @param ptr    address in memory
00486  * @param mask   mask of bits to set
00487  *
00488  * @return Value of memory location before setting bits
00489  */
00490 static inline uint64_t cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_bset64_nosync(uint64_t * ptr, uint64_t mask)
00491 {
00492     uint64_t tmp, ret;
00493 
00494     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00495                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00496                  "1: lld  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00497                  "   move %[ret], %[tmp] \n"
00498                  "   or   %[tmp], %[msk] \n"
00499                  "   scd  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00500                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n" "   nop                 \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret)
00501                  :[msk] "r"(mask)
00502                  :"memory");
00503 
00504     return (ret);
00505 }
00506 
00507 /**
00508  * Atomically set bits in a 32 bit (aligned) memory location,
00509  * and returns previous value.
00510  *
00511  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00512  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00513  * ordering constraints.
00514  *
00515  * @param ptr    address in memory
00516  * @param mask   mask of bits to set
00517  *
00518  * @return Value of memory location before setting bits
00519  */
00520 static inline uint32_t cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_bset32_nosync(uint32_t * ptr, uint32_t mask)
00521 {
00522     uint32_t tmp, ret;
00523 
00524     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00525                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00526                  "1: ll   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00527                  "   move %[ret], %[tmp] \n"
00528                  "   or   %[tmp], %[msk] \n"
00529                  "   sc   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00530                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n" "   nop                 \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret)
00531                  :[msk] "r"(mask)
00532                  :"memory");
00533 
00534     return (ret);
00535 }
00536 
00537 /**
00538  * Atomically clear bits in a 64 bit (aligned) memory location,
00539  * and returns previous value.
00540  *
00541  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00542  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00543  * ordering constraints.
00544  *
00545  * @param ptr    address in memory
00546  * @param mask   mask of bits to clear
00547  *
00548  * @return Value of memory location before clearing bits
00549  */
00550 static inline uint64_t cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_bclr64_nosync(uint64_t * ptr, uint64_t mask)
00551 {
00552     uint64_t tmp, ret;
00553 
00554     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00555                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00556                  "   nor  %[msk], 0      \n"
00557                  "1: lld  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00558                  "   move %[ret], %[tmp] \n"
00559                  "   and  %[tmp], %[msk] \n"
00560                  "   scd  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00561                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n" "   nop                 \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret),[msk] "+r"(mask)
00562                  ::"memory");
00563 
00564     return (ret);
00565 }
00566 
00567 /**
00568  * Atomically clear bits in a 32 bit (aligned) memory location,
00569  * and returns previous value.
00570  *
00571  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00572  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00573  * ordering constraints.
00574  *
00575  * @param ptr    address in memory
00576  * @param mask   mask of bits to clear
00577  *
00578  * @return Value of memory location before clearing bits
00579  */
00580 static inline uint32_t cvmx_atomic_fetch_and_bclr32_nosync(uint32_t * ptr, uint32_t mask)
00581 {
00582     uint32_t tmp, ret;
00583 
00584     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00585                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00586                  "   nor  %[msk], 0      \n"
00587                  "1: ll   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00588                  "   move %[ret], %[tmp] \n"
00589                  "   and  %[tmp], %[msk] \n"
00590                  "   sc   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00591                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n" "   nop                 \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret),[msk] "+r"(mask)
00592                  ::"memory");
00593 
00594     return (ret);
00595 }
00596 
00597 /**
00598  * Atomically swaps value in 64 bit (aligned) memory location,
00599  * and returns previous value.
00600  *
00601  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00602  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00603  * ordering constraints.
00604  *
00605  * @param ptr       address in memory
00606  * @param new_val   new value to write
00607  *
00608  * @return Value of memory location before swap operation
00609  */
00610 static inline uint64_t cvmx_atomic_swap64_nosync(uint64_t * ptr, uint64_t new_val)
00611 {
00612     uint64_t ret;
00613 
00614 #ifdef CVMX_CAVIUM_OCTEON2
00615     {
00616         if (__builtin_constant_p(new_val) && new_val == 0) {
00617             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00618                          "lacd  %0,(%1)"
00619                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret):"r"(ptr):"memory");
00620         } else if (__builtin_constant_p(new_val) && new_val == ~0ull) {
00621             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00622                          "lasd  %0,(%1)"
00623                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret):"r"(ptr):"memory");
00624         } else {
00625             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00626                          "lawd  %0,(%1),%2"
00627                           CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret):"r"(ptr), "r"(new_val):"memory");
00628         }
00629     }
00630 #else
00631     {
00632         uint64_t tmp;
00633         __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00634                      ".set noreorder         \n"
00635                      "1: lld  %[ret], %[val] \n"
00636                      "   move %[tmp], %[new_val] \n"
00637                      "   scd  %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00638                      "   beqz %[tmp],  1b    \n"
00639                      "     nop                 \n"
00640                      ".set pop           \n"
00641                      : [val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret)
00642                      : [new_val] "r"(new_val)
00643                      : "memory");
00644     }
00645 #endif
00646 
00647     return (ret);
00648 }
00649 
00650 /**
00651  * Atomically swaps value in 32 bit (aligned) memory location,
00652  * and returns previous value.
00653  *
00654  * This version does not perform 'sync' operations to enforce memory
00655  * operations.  This should only be used when there are no memory operation
00656  * ordering constraints.
00657  *
00658  * @param ptr       address in memory
00659  * @param new_val   new value to write
00660  *
00661  * @return Value of memory location before swap operation
00662  */
00663 static inline uint32_t cvmx_atomic_swap32_nosync(uint32_t * ptr, uint32_t new_val)
00664 {
00665     uint32_t ret;
00666 
00667 #ifdef CVMX_CAVIUM_OCTEON2
00668     {
00669         if (__builtin_constant_p(new_val) && new_val == 0) {
00670             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00671                          "lac  %0,(%1)"
00672                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret):"r"(ptr):"memory");
00673         } else if (__builtin_constant_p(new_val) && new_val == ~0u) {
00674             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00675                          "las  %0,(%1)"
00676                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret):"r"(ptr):"memory");
00677         } else {
00678             __asm__ __volatile__(CVMX_PUSH_OCTEON2_STR
00679                          "law  %0,(%1),%2"
00680                          CVMX_POP_OCTEON2_STR:"=r"(ret):"r"(ptr), "r"(new_val):"memory");
00681         }
00682     }
00683 #else
00684     {
00685         uint32_t tmp;
00686 
00687         __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00688                      ".set noreorder         \n"
00689                      "1: ll   %[ret], %[val] \n"
00690                      "   move %[tmp], %[new_val] \n"
00691                      "   sc   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00692                      "   beqz %[tmp],  1b    \n" "   nop                 \n" ".set pop           \n":[val] "+m"(*ptr),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[ret] "=&r"(ret)
00693                      :[new_val] "r"(new_val)
00694                      :"memory");
00695     }
00696 #endif
00697 
00698     return (ret);
00699 }
00700 
00701 #ifdef CVMX_CAVIUM_OCTEON3
00702 /**
00703  * Atomically sets a 128 bit (aligned) memory location to a value
00704  *
00705  * @param ptr    address of memory to set
00706  * @param value  value to set memory location to.
00707  *
00708  * @return 0 on success, -1 on error
00709  */
00710 static inline int cvmx_atomic_set128(void *ptr, int64_t value[2])
00711 {
00712     unsigned off;
00713     unsigned long pl, ph;
00714     uint64_t tmp, ls, ms;
00715     uint64_t lm_loc = CVMX_SCRATCH_BASE + CVMX_PKO_LMTLINE * CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE;
00716 
00717     if (cvmx_unlikely(!OCTEON_IS_OCTEON3())) {
00718         cvmx_warn("atomic_set128: not supported on this chip\n");
00719         return -1;
00720     }
00721 
00722     pl = (unsigned long)ptr;
00723     ph = pl + 8;
00724     if ((pl & 7) || ((pl ^ ph) & ~0x7ful)) {
00725         cvmx_warn("atomic_set128: Improper alignment\n");
00726         return -1;
00727     }
00728 
00729     off = (uintptr_t)ptr & (CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE-1);
00730     lm_loc += off;
00731 
00732     ls = value[0]; /* least significant */
00733     ms = value[1]; /* most significant */
00734     /* See HRM section 2.23.2 */
00735     do {
00736         tmp = ms;
00737         asm volatile(
00738             "\n"
00739             "   .set push\n"
00740             "   .set noreorder\n"
00741             "   lld $0, 0(%[ptr])\n"
00742             "   sd  %[ls], 0(%[lm_loc])\n"
00743             "   scd %[tmp], 8(%[ptr])\n"
00744             "   .set pop"
00745             : [tmp] "+&r" (tmp)
00746             : [lm_loc] "r" (lm_loc), [ls] "r" (ls), [ptr] "r" (pl)
00747             : "memory"); 
00748     } while (tmp == 0);
00749     return 0;
00750 }
00751 #endif /* CVMX_CAVIUM_OCTEON3 */
00752 
00753 /**
00754  * Returns the current value of a 128 bit (aligned) memory
00755  * location.
00756  *
00757  * @param ptr    Address of memory to get
00758  * @para [out] data An array of two 64-bit words to hold the result
00759  *
00760  * @return 0 on success, -1 on error
00761  */
00762 static inline int cvmx_atomic_get128(void *ptr, int64_t *data)
00763 {
00764     unsigned long pl, ph;
00765     uint64_t ms, ls, tmp, start_cycle, end_cycle;
00766 
00767     pl = (unsigned long)ptr;
00768     ph = pl + 8;
00769     if ((pl & 7) || ((pl ^ ph) & ~0x7ful)) {
00770         cvmx_warn("atomic_set128: Improper alignment\n");
00771         return -1;
00772     }
00773 
00774     /* If the elapsed time to do two loads from locations in the
00775      * same cache line is 10 cycles or less, then no intervening
00776      * cache miss could have occurred, and the loads were atomic.
00777      * If it took more than 10 cycles, then there may have been a
00778      * cache miss, and we retry.
00779      */
00780     do {
00781         asm volatile(
00782             "\n"
00783             "   .set push\n"
00784             "   .set noreorder\n"
00785             "   rdhwr   %[sc], $31\n"
00786             "   ld  %[ls], 0(%[ptr])\n"
00787             "   ld  %[ms], 8(%[ptr])\n"
00788             /* Consume the results of the two LD */
00789             "   or  %[tmp], %[ms], %[ls]\n"
00790             "   rdhwr   %[ec], $31\n"
00791             "   .set pop"
00792             : [sc] "=&r" (start_cycle),  [ec] "=&r" (end_cycle),
00793             [tmp] "=&r" (tmp), [ms] "=&r" (ms), [ls] "=&r" (ls)
00794             : [ptr] "r" (pl)
00795             );
00796     } while (end_cycle - start_cycle > 10);
00797 
00798     data[0] = ls; /* least significant */
00799     data[1] = ms; /* most significant */
00800 
00801     return 0;
00802 }
00803 
00804 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00805 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00806 }
00807 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00808 #endif
00809 
00810 #endif /* __CVMX_ATOMIC_H__ */
